Title(s): The Anonymous Short Metrical Chronicle of England
_description: The Anonymous Short Metrical Chronicle of England — in couplets

BodRawF145.First Lines:
In that tyme þe pope of romeHe be thowth hym wel swythe
                    sone…
BodRawF145.Last Lines:
…He lete hym in a schryne doneBothe with flesshe & with
                    bone
BodRawF145.Note:
C-text; fragment: 226 lines, corresponding to lines 301-66, 629-766 of
                        London,  British Library Royal 12 C.XII, A-text.
BodRawF145.Editions:
Carroll,  Marion Crane,  and  Rosemond Tuve.  
             “Two Manuscripts of the Middle English Anonymous Riming
                Chronicle.” 
             PMLA
         46 (1931): 115-54: 117-48.

CULDd142.First Lines:
Herkeniþ hederward lordyngishe þat wollen here of
                    kyngis…
CULDd142.Last Lines:
…praying for þe pees to our gode spedeNow Ihesu Cristys
                    sone help vs þerto vp oure grete nede

CULFf548.First Lines:
Herkenet hiderward lordyngesȝe that willen here of
                    kynges…
CULFf548.Last Lines: …thrugh his hestis tensyng we now alle Amen
CULFf548.Note:
Headings for each king, e.g., ‘After him regned edwarde his
                    sone’ (f. 112).
CULFf548.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 249-87.

BLAdd19677.First Lines:
Herkeneþ hider ward ȝe lordyngesȜe þat wollen
                    ihure of kynges…
BLAdd19677.Last Lines:
…Þoru his hestis þat beþ ten& sei we alle
                    nou amen amen
BLAdd19677.Editions:
Zettl,  Ewald,
                        ed.  
             An Anonymous Short English Metrical Chronicle.
EETS
         o.s. 196 (1935); repr. 1971: 1-45 (with all variants).

BLCottCalAXI.First Lines:
After þe king lud Regnede king bladudHe was a kelere of
                    nigremancie…
BLCottCalAXI.Last Lines:
…For god ne was noȝt ȝut iborNe deþ soff rede
                    him bifore
BLCottCalAXI.Note:
C-text; a single leaf, 48 lines. Corrected (Hamer (1995)
XHamer,  Richard. 
             A Manuscript Index to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: British Library, 1995,
                    note) from London,  British Library Cotton Caligula A.IX.

BLRoy12Cxii.First Lines:
HErkneþ hedeward LordyngesȜe þat wolleþ here of
                    kynges…
BLRoy12Cxii.Last Lines:
…At gauerssich ȝe mowe wyteÞer his heued wes of
                    smyte

Digital Facsimile of British Library Royal MS 12 C XII.

BLRoy12Cxii.Editions:
Ritson,  Joseph,
                        ed.  
             Ancient English Metrical Romances.
         3 vols. London, 1802; rev. Edmund Goldsmid and repr. Edinburgh:
            Goldlsmid, 1884: 2.270-31.
O’Farrell-Tate,  Una,
                        ed.  
             The Abridged English Metrical Brut: Edited from British Library MS
                Royal 12 C.xii.
         Middle English Texts 32. Heidelberg: Carl Winter
            Universitätsverlag: Hedelberg, 2002.

NLS1921.First Lines:
Herkeneþ hiderward lordingesȜe þat wil here of
                    kinges…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…Þurth his hates þat be tenSay we now alle
                    amen
NLS1921.Attributed Title:
Explicit Liber Regum Anglie (f. 317rb); Here may men rede who so
                    can / hou Inglond first bigan / þen mow it finde In englische / as þe
                    brout it telleþ y wiis (f. 304ra)
NLS1921.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,  and  I. C. Cunningham, eds.  
             The Auchinleck Manuscript. National Library of Scotland
                Advocates’ MS. 19.2.1.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
NLS1921.Editions:
Carroll,  Marion Crane,  and  Rosemond Tuve.  
             “Two Manuscripts of the Middle English Anonymous Riming
                Chronicle.” 
             PMLA
         46 (1931): 115-54: 117-48.

AmsterdamBPHM199.First Lines: After [the] king Ludreigned his sonne bladud…
AmsterdamBPHM199.Last Lines:
…þe thyrd ele;omg streate isþe iiijth
                    sottis diche ywis &c
AmsterdamBPHM199.Note:
A fragment, equivalent to lines 151-224 in Zettl (1935)
XZettl,  Ewald. 
             An Anonymous Short English Metrical Chronicle.
EETS
         o.s. 196 (1935); repr. 1971;
                    leaves misbound.
AmsterdamBPHM199.Editions:
Grund,  Peter. 
             “A Previously Unrecorded Fragment of the Middle English Short
                    Metrical Chronicle in Bibliotheca Philosophica Hermetica M199.” 
             English Studies
         87 (2006): 277-93: 289-90.
